com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.csb

Class SimpleNavigationEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.csb.Environment
      • com.ojcoleman.ahni.experiments.csb.SimpleNavigationEnvironment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StaticTransformEnvironment

    public class SimpleNavigationEnvironment
extends Environment

    Implements an environment that essentially represents a simple navigation like task. The agent perceives the current state as is (no transformation is performed between the environments current state and the agents perception of it). The agent can directly move around within the Cartesian space represented by the environment state space: the agents output is interpreted as a motion vector which changes the current state in a linear additive way. The reward signal, which is a function of the Euclidean distance from the current environment state to the goal state, is provided directly to the agent.

    Environments can optionally have (hyper-)spherical obstacles added at random locations (increasing the environment difficulty increases the number of obstacles). The agent cannot directly perceive the obstacles. If the environment size (dimensionality) is 2 then the images generated by RLContinuousStateBased will include the obstacle locations.

    • Field Detail

      • OBSTACLE_COUNT_INITIAL

        public static final java.lang.String OBSTACLE_COUNT_INITIAL
        The initial number of obstacles that should be included. Default is 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OBSTACLE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA

        public static final java.lang.String OBSTACLE_COUNT_INCREASE_DELTA
        The amount to increase the obstacle count when environments with the current value have been sufficiently mastered (see RLContinuousStateBased.DIFFICULTY_INCREASE_PERFORMANCE. If the value is followed by an "x" then the value is considered a factor (and so should be > 1). Default is 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OBSTACLE_COUNT_MAX

        public static final java.lang.String OBSTACLE_COUNT_MAX
        The maximum amount to increase the obstacle count to. Default is lots.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • logToImage

        public void logToImage(java.lang.String baseFileName,
              int imageSize)
        Optionally allow rendering the environment configuration to an image or images. This method is called once for a set of trials. Implementations must handle creating the images and saving them to disk. This implementation renders the obstacles in the environment iff the environment size (dimensions) == 2.
        Overrides:
        logToImage in class Environment
        Parameters:
        baseFileName - The directory and base file name to use for the images saved to disk.
        imageSize - The (suggested) image size.

      • logToImageForTrial

        public void logToImageForTrial(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                      int imageSize)
        Optionally allow rendering (some aspect) of the environment configuration to an image. The image is used to track the progress of the agent through the environment. This method is called for every trial and is only called if the environment size is 2 (thus allowing showing the current state as a point on a 2D plane). An example implementation may render parts of the state space that are inaccessible. This implementation renders the obstacles in the environment image.
        Overrides:
        logToImageForTrial in class Environment
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to render on.
        imageSize - The size of the image (width and height).
